thread.title: X Factor 2015: Meet the 12 finalists who'll be performing at the live shows
thread.title_full: X Factor 2015: Meet the 12 finalists who'll be performing at the live shows

title: X Factor 2015: Meet the 12 finalists who'll be performing at the live shows
text:
Age: 17 years old, from Essex
In her first audition: Louisa performed Michael Jackson’s Who’s Loving You 
Louisa says her “main goal” is to have Beyonce’s phone number in her phone book. 
After the last episode, bookies Coral declared her the favourite to be crowned winner of this year’s show. The youngest in the competition, she belted out Aretha Franklin’s Respect, blowing away Rita and guest judge Meghan Trainor. 
Rita declared: “That is what you call an audition.” 
Lauren Murray. Age: 26 years old, from North London
In her first audition: Lauren performed Jocelyn Brown’s Somebody Else’s Guy 
At Judges’ Houses, Meghan admitted she hadn’t been a fan of Lauren after watching her original audition – but had changed her mind: “I love her in person, I’m obsessed with her. That audition was like, ‘I’m here to stay, I’m not going home’.” 
Rita said: “The one thing that worries me is her stage presence,”– but she was won round, and let Lauren through to the live performances. 
Kiera Weathers. (Thames/Syco) Age: 18 years old, from St Helens
In her first audition: Keira performed Ella Eyre’s We Don’t Have To Take Our Clothes Off 
Kiera narrowly edged out Monica Michael to take Rita’s third nomination for the live shows. 
The barmaid from St Helens has previously talked about her mother dying after a battle with alcoholism two years ago – and how that has spurred her on to follow her singing dream. Cheryl Fernandez-Versini’s Groups 
4th Impact. (Syco/Thames TV) The band are: Mylene (23), Irene (25), Almira (27) and Celina (19). The band are four sisters who have grown up singing and dancing together.
In their first audition: they performed Jessie J’s Bang Bang 
The band have described themselves as “very fierce, energetic, powerful performers with angelic harmonies.” 
The Filipino siblings have been one of the frontrunners in the competition and were the first group selected. They sealed their place with a performance of Eminem’s Love The Way You Lie ft Rihanna. 
Alien Uncovered. (Syco/Thames TV) The band are: Madison (19), Natalie (18), Temple (24), Frank (17), Yaz (23) and Shae (23). They have been together for eighteen months.
In their first audition: they performed The Black Eyed Peas’ Pump It 
The band have said that their mentor Cheryl is “cool” enough to be “an Alien” herself. Their raunchy rendition of Usher’s Bad Girl impressed their mentor and her guest judge in Rome, rising pop star Jess Glynne. 
Reggie n Bollie. (Syco/Thames TV) 
The band are: Reggie (31) and Bollie (29). The band have been together for three and a half years and originally called themselves Menn On Point. 
In their first audition: the band performed their own song, Turn It Up 
This was a surprise choice as the Ghanaian duo beat gospel groups BEKLN Mile and Melody Tone. 
Their interpretation of Twist And Shout, the song made famous by The Beatles, helped them win that all-important spot in the live shows. 
“We are going to entertain you every week!” they vowed. Simon Cowell’s Overs
